forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 53. South southwest wind around 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 10 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the evening deepens over Downtown San Francisco, a veil of clouds cloaks the sky, signaling the imminent arrival of rain. The air tinged with the fresh scent of damp earth suggests a gentle shift in the atmosphere; with temperatures lingering in the low fifties and a soft, southwest breeze rustling through the city, one can feel nature's pulse quickening as night approaches. The forecast speaks of rain showers likely to begin after 11 PM, offering neither a surge nor a sigh, but rather an understated promise of renewal with the expectancy of a light accumulation.

Tomorrow, the clouds will continue their dance, allowing brief glimpses of the sun to peek through as temperatures hover around a modest fifty-eight degrees, retreating to the mid-fifties by afternoon. The winds will assert their presence a bit more boldly, gusting between ten and sixteen miles per hour, lending an edge to the otherwise tranquil scene. It may be a fine day for some quiet indoor pursuits—perhaps a visit to a cozy café, where one can luxuriate in a warm drink while watching the world shuffle by. A light jacket and a comfortable pair of shoes should suffice, while an umbrella might be a wise companion as the rains arrive, reminding us that even in our bustling city, there exists a subtle, elegant beauty in the unfolding weather.
